result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Gregory McChesney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $200 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Uncharged Bail Jumping charge stemming from an OWI received by the defendant in Marquette County on May 22, 2015 dismissed and read in.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Gregory McChesney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand

Case called @ 3:18 p.m. Defendant Jonathan Gregory McChesney in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Uncharged bail jumping charge stemming from an OWI charge received by the defendant on May 22, 2015 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: 75 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - AODA and follow through,  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The defendant is eligible for expungment upon successful completion of probation. Bond previously posted to be applied.  Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Michael Ross Blum in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Blum requesting another STC as the DE has received new charges in another county. The court will schedule a plea/sentencing hearing in anticipation that the parties will have the matter resolved.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:17 PM: Defendant Jonathan Gregory McChesney in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - not currently employed.  Def introduced to SPD who is present in the courtroom.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD on eligibility.  Back of Record at 2:39 PM:  Def has been found eligible for SPD services and appears with SPD Szilagyi.  NGP received and entered.   DA argues for cash bond w/conditions.  SPD argues for Signature Bond.  The Court:  Orders $200 Cash Bond w/conditions.  SPD will be appointing counsel.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:40 am.
